intro: Echites torosus var. brownei, commonly known as the Brown's echites, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
